panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for EMC Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for EMC Ignition Applications. The table below compares the existing installation of this product on this system, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined tag providers and database connections for both production and isolation-mode (test) environments as appropriate.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms before proceeding.

panel.title: Site Selection
panel.preamble: This install package contains site-specific information. Select the site appropriate to the current gateway.

panel.title: Common interface Definitions
panel.preamble: Specify tag provider and database connections as used by various Ignition Applications. Both production and test mode versions of provider and database must be specified. The selections here are used by subsequent screens.

panel.title: Verify User Roles
panel.preamble: Check authentication profiles to verify that at least one of them includes a user assigned to each role utilized by the product.

panel.title: Custom Icons for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Custom icons are used extensively when drawing blocks in the Block Language Toolkit. They may also be found in many of the user screens.

panel.title: Python Code for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page loads Python code that supports the Ignition Application suite. The Python is divided into two categories: code developed by ILS Automation that is generic and used in multiple products, and code specific to the current XOM applications. A third category consists of Java jar files that are referenced by the Python.

artifact.name: Jar Files to Support External Python

panel.title: BRPO Database Create and Alter Scripts for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the PRODUCTION instance.

panel.title: Halobutyl Database Create and Alter Scripts for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the PRODUCTION instance.

panel.title: Database Create and Alter Scripts for Test
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the ISOLATION instance.

panel.title: Vistalon Database Create and Alter Scripts for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the PRODUCTION instance.

panel.title: Database Create and Alter Scripts for Test
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the ISOLATION instance.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs modules necessary for the EMC applications. IMPORTANT: If this is the first time that you have installed these modules on your system, they will be placed in quarantine mode. To complete the installation, you will have to navigate to the Modules page and select the install option next to the listing of each module.

panel.title: Create BRPO-specific Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Create Escorez-specific Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Create Halobutyl-specific Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Create G-line-specific Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Create Vistalon-specific Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the BRPO applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Install Tags Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page defines memory tags that are used by the Ignition Applications when running in ISOLATION mode at BRPO.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the Escorez applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the G-Line applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the Halobutyl applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Install Tags Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page defines memory tags that are used by the Ignition Applications when running in ISOLATION mode at Halobutyl.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the Vistalon applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Install Tags Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page defines tags that are used by the Ignition Applications when running in ISOLATION mode at Vistalon.

panel.title: Install Lab Tag Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page defines tags that are used by the Ignition Applications when running in ISOLATION mode at Vistalon. These are the tags for lab data.

panel.title: BRPO Main Project
panel.preamble:
XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.
NOTE: For the current EMChemicals project, the merge capability is still in development and should NOT be used.

panel.title: BRPO Alarm Pipeline
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of Alarm Pipelines for BRPO. It is packaged as an Ignition global projects and completely replaces any existing pipelines of the same name.

panel.title: Escorez Main Project
panel.preamble:
XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.
NOTE: For the current EMChemicals project, the merge capability is still in development and should NOT be used.

panel.title: Escorez SFC
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of charts for SFC projects migrated for Escorez. The charts are packaged as Ignition global projects. They completely replace any existing charts of the same name.

panel.title: GLine Main Project
panel.preamble:
XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.
NOTE: For the current EMChemicals project, the merge capability is still in development and should NOT be used.

panel.title: Halobutyl Main Project
panel.preamble:
XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.
NOTE: For the current EMChemicals project, the merge capability is still in development and should NOT be used.

panel.title: Halobutyl SFC and Alarm Pipeline
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of vetted SFC charts and Alarm Pipelines for Halobutyl. The charts are packaged as Ignition global projects. They completely replace any existing charts of the same name.

panel.title: Vistalon Main Project
panel.preamble:
XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.
NOTE: For the current EMChemicals project, the merge capability is still in development and should NOT be used.

panel.title: Vistalon SFCs and Alarm Pipelines
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of vetted SFC charts and Alarm Pipelines for Vistalon. The charts are packaged as an Ignition global project. They completely replace any existing charts of the same name.

panel.title: Install the DbManager Project
panel.preamble: DbManager is a utility for maintenance of application databases. It is not generally user-customizable. The action on this page completely replaces any existing copy.

panel.title: Product Documentation
panel.preamble: The list below contains both user-level and design documents. They may be downloaded individually,as needed.

artifact.name: Diagnostic Toolkit User Interface Test Spec

panel.title: Update Toolkit Properties
panel.preamble: Set properties in the internal database of the Gateway. These particular parameters define extension functions that update the database in response to operator operations on diagrams.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of EMC Ignition Applications in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Ignition Applications - Installed
epilog.preamble: Now that all of the automated installation and configuration of the Exxon-Mobil Ignition Applications is complete, there are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: If this is the first time that a particular module has been installed, then it will be in a quarantined state at the end of the installation. Navigate to the "Module" screen on the Gateway page. Select the "install" option next to the listing of each quarantined module.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Restart the Gateway, then edit each project setting it to "enabled".
